title: Daily Mail editor Geordie Greig seeks to overtake The Sun
text:
The editor of the Daily Mail, Geordie Greig, has said he hopes it will overtake The Sun as Britain's best-selling paper.

Advertisers have returned to the newspaper in the past year, said Mr Greig, who took over from 26-year veteran Paul Dacre in September last year.

Mr Greig said 265 advertisers had come back to the Daily Mail in the past year since Mr Dacre's departure, including the likes of Nationwide, TalkTalk and BP.

Speaking of his newspaper’s rivalry with The Sun, he said: “We’re going to give them a jolly good go.”

The rise of internet news has hit newspaper sales and taken a toll on advertising revenues in the industry.
